title: Fix your ridiculous servers.
body:
I check my internet provider before every ranked game I play using speedtest.com
This is to ensure when I play my ranked games I *won't* experience any bad latency.
League of Legends seems to intentionally *fuck me over* every 1/5 games I play during ranked with its horrendous server lagg.
My ping spikes from 40ms to 500ms throughout these games giving my team and I a ridiculous disadvantage. This puts me, the player at fault for screwing my team over due to YOUR ridiculous servers. PLEASE FIX THEM. How hard is it to maintain a steady latency for your players who GENEROUSLY spend money on your game. Rant over.

replies.body:
So I'll start by saying that there are an immense number of factors that go into steady/reliable data flow and there is a HUGE difference between what your connection/ISP can provide you in terms of load speeds of a website and steady communication to a game server. A lot of it is boring and not worth dealing with but just know that there's more to it than just "Riot fix your servers".

However, Riot are actually working to make arrangements/agreements with various ISPs to try and correct the problems because honestly most of the time it's probably bottlenecks/faults/old-equipment in the physical network (ie your ISP or more likely Telstra) that's causing your problems.

Think of it like this: It's actually relatively easy to build a giant Bunnings warehouse with a massive parking lot so that there's enough  room for every single customer. But if you have to drive down single lane dirt roads that have road works going on every other day you're still going to have difficulties getting there.  


PS: Here's a red post about what they actually are doing for OCE: http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/miscellaneous/iFdEkXnp-riot-oce-update-and-qa?comment=0000

Yea I don't have this issue mate.

I use a wired connection as well.

its crappy DSL as well I get a smooth 70ms and I live about as south as you can get internet.

so to sum up its either 
your network
your ISP
your computer
people sharing your network

not riots server
I learnt the only fix is wired connection where the server doesn't lose god damn 35% of packets transferring data to you
